newsitem.title: LATVIA: IMF pleased as Latvia passes balanced budget.
newsitem.headline: IMF pleased as Latvia passes balanced budget.

text.p: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Wednesday said it was pleased that Latvia's parliament had passed a deficit-free budget for 1997.
"On the basis of my understanding, this is a very good development in line with Latvia's commitment to the IMF," IMF resident representative Dimitri Demekas told Reuters.
"We are very pleased that the government has been able to pass this budget," he added.
A balanced budget was one of the key elements of Latvia's agreement with the IMF for access to a standby credit.
Demekas said the balanced 1997 budget would help bring down inflation and increase efficiency in all areas of government spending.
He also said that the IMF saw Latvia as recovering quicker than expected from its banking crisis last year.
He said that gross domestic product (GDP) could grow by 1.5 to three percent in 1996 and by three percent or more next year if prudent fiscal policies were followed.
